item.name: Air Signs
item.description: The signs of Gemini, Libra, and Aquarius.

item.name: Ascendent
item.description: Your ascendant is the "mask" you present to people. It can be seen in your personal style and how you come off to people when you first meet. Some say it becomes less relevant as you get older. It changes every two hours, so if it doesn't make sense, reconfirm your birth time to be sure.

item.name: Cardinal
item.description: The signs of Aries, Cancer, Libra, and Capricorn

item.name: Earth Sign
item.description: The signs of Taurus, Virgo, and Capricorn.

item.name: Element
item.description: One of the four substances thought in ancient and medieval cosmology to constitute the universe (earth, air, water, or fire).

item.name: Feminine
item.description: The signs of Taurus, Cancer, Virgo, Scorpio, Capricorn, and Pisces. The remaining 6 signs of the zodiac are masculine signs. Feminine signs are also referred to as negative or receptive signs.

item.name: Fire Sign
item.description: The signs of Aries, Leo, and Sagittarius.

item.name: Fixed
item.description: Of, relating to, or belonging to the group consisting of the four signs of the zodiac Taurus, Leo, Scorpio, and Aquarius, which are associated with stability

item.name: Masculine
item.description: The signs of Aries, Gemini, Leo, Libra, Sagittarius, and Aquarius. The remaining 6 signs of the zodiac are feminine signs. Masculine signs are also referred to as "positive" signs.

item.name: Modality
item.description: The modality or mode of a given sign refers to its position in the season it is found in.

item.name: Moon Sign
item.description: The moon rules your emotions, moods, and feelings. This is likely the sign you most think of yourself as, since it reflects your personality when you're alone or deeply comfortable.

item.name: Mutable
item.description: Relating to four of the signs of the zodiac, Gemini, Virgo, Sagittarius, and Pisces, which are associated with the quality of adaptability.

item.name: Natal Chart
item.description: A natal chart is a map of the sky from when and where you were born that shows which constellation (sign) a planet was in front of when you were born. In astrology, a natal chart indicates your character traits, behavioral tendencies, hidden desires, and the directions your life might take. It shows the location of each planet, along with the sign and house it appeared in at that moment.

item.name: Planets
item.description: Each zodiac sign is represented by a planet in the solar system, and each planet have characteristics for the individuals personality.

item.name: Polarity
item.description: The concept of Polarity is related to the Ascendant/Descendant axis. Both elements are important in analyzing our astrological personality.

item.name: Sun Sign
item.description: The sun determines your ego, identity, and "role" in life. It's the core of who you are, and is the sign you're most likely to already know.

item.name: Symbol
item.description: These are icons that represent the 12 different zodiac signs.

item.name: Water Sign
item.description: The signs of Cancer, Scorpio, and Pisces.

item.name: Zodiac
item.description: A circle of 360 degrees, divided into 12 equal sectors of 30 degrees each that are the astrology signs.
